note: Focuses on science, mathematics, computing and engineering programmes with strong theoretical and practical foundations.
Programmes are designed to prepare graduates for industry, research, teaching and further postgraduate studies.
Emphasizes critical thinking, quantitative reasoning and hands-on problem solving.

fees: ICT (Okwahu/Kumasi campus): check current tuition per semester from the official fee schedule; ICT fees are typically in the mid range among science programmes.
salary: Entry-level ICT salaries in Ghana vary by sector and company; experienced IT professionals often earn significantly more in both local and international roles.
cutt_off: General requirement: WASSCE aggregate 36 or better / SSSCE aggregate 24 or better.

Applicants must have credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science, plus three relevant electives (e.g. ICT, Elective Mathematics, Physics or other science/technical subjects).
mode: Full-time on-campus (day and in some cases weekend, depending on campus and intake).
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1–C6) in six (6) subjects comprising three (3) Core subjects including English Language and Core Mathematics, plus three (3) relevant Elective subjects with aggregate 36 or better.
SSSCE: Passes (A–D) in six (6) subjects comprising three (3) Core subjects including English Language and Core Mathematics, plus three (3) relevant Electives with aggregate 24 or better.
Mature applicants: At least 25 years old with relevant work experience and passes in an entrance examination and/or interview.
Other equivalent qualifications (GCE, foreign certificates, recognised diplomas) are evaluated case-by-case.
level_note: Provides a broad and practical foundation in ICT with emphasis on business and organisational applications.
Suitable for students targeting roles in software development, systems support, networking and IT-enabled business operations.

career: Teacher/Lecturer (with education training or higher degrees)

fees: Mathematics programmes: check the current “Mathematics” fee band for Okwahu/Kumasi campuses; typically slightly below ICT fees.
salary: Maths/statistics graduates can work in finance, research, education and analytics; salaries depend on sector (e.g. banking, government, NGOs, private analytics firms).
cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate 36 or better / SSSCE aggregate 24 or better with strong performance in Mathematics-related electives.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
entry_requirements: Credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science plus credit passes in three (3) relevant elective subjects such as Elective Mathematics, Physics, Economics or other approved combinations.
General WASSCE/SSSCE aggregates must meet the University’s minimum of 36 (WASSCE) or 24 (SSSCE) or better.
Equivalent GCE and foreign qualifications accepted per University policy.
level_note: Emphasizes strong mathematical foundations with applied statistics.
Good preparation for roles requiring quantitative analysis or for further studies in statistics, data science or actuarial science.

fees: Mathematics with Accounting: same band as other Mathematics programmes; consult the University’s fee schedule.
salary: Combining maths and accounting can support progression into finance, banking, analytics and professional accounting with competitive salaries.
cutt_off: Meets general undergraduate standard with strong passes in Elective Mathematics and business-related electives (e.g. Accounting, Economics).
mode: Full-time on-campus.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with the general aggregate requirement (36/24 or better) and credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science.
Elective subjects should include Elective Mathematics and at least one business-related elective such as Accounting, Business Management or Economics.
Other acceptable qualifications as defined in the University’s admission regulations.
level_note: Bridges rigorous mathematics with accounting, offering flexible options in finance, banking, analytics and teaching.
Suitable for numerate students who also like business and accounting.

fees: Computer Engineering: check the current engineering/science fee band for Kumasi/Okwahu campuses; higher than some non-lab-based programmes due to lab components.
salary: Computer engineers can earn strong salaries in technology, telecoms and embedded systems sectors, especially with experience and certifications.
cutt_off: Applicants must satisfy at least the general aggregate of 36/24 or better and have credit passes in Elective Mathematics and Physics, plus one other relevant elective.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
Significant laboratory and project-based learning.
entry_requirements: Credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science plus three (3) Elective subjects including Physics and Elective Mathematics; aggregate 36 (WASSCE) or 24 (SSSCE) or better.
GCE and equivalent qualifications with strong Mathematics and Physics background considered per University policy.
Mature and diploma/HND holders evaluated individually for possible advanced standing.
level_note: Integrates hardware and software, preparing graduates for embedded systems, hardware design and systems engineering roles.
Good option for students who enjoy both computing and electronics.

fees: ICT-related Masters fees follow the graduate programme band; total cost is moderate relative to other private universities and published per cohort.
salary: Postgraduate ICT managers often hold mid- to senior-level roles with compensation reflecting responsibility, sector and experience.
mode: Designed for working professionals (evening, weekend or modular formats).
entry_requirements: Good first degree in ICT, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business IT or a related area from a recognised institution.
Applicants with other degrees but substantial IT/IS management experience may also be considered.
Meeting School of Graduate Studies’ additional requirements (e.g. references, interview).
level_note: Focuses on the management and strategic use of ICT in organisations rather than purely technical aspects.
Suited to professionals moving into IT leadership, IT-enabled business transformation or consulting.

fees: Diploma-level fees are lower than degree programmes; see the diploma band on the fee schedule.
salary: Diploma computing roles start at junior-level pay; earnings can grow with experience and further study.
mode: Full-time or flexible schedules, depending on cohort.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with passes in six (6) subjects including English Language and Mathematics; at least three (3) credit passes in relevant electives.
Other equivalent qualifications as accepted by the University.
level_note: Provides foundational computing skills for students not yet ready for direct degree entry.
Can serve as a pathway to BSc ICT or related programmes with good performance.

courses.course_name: Diploma in Information and Digital Technologies

fees: Uses the standard diploma fee band for computing-related programmes.
electives: Introduction to Web and Social Media Technologies
salary: Diploma-level graduates typically start in entry-level support roles; further study and certifications can increase earning potential.
mode: Full-time; some flexible options may be available depending on demand.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with required passes including English Language and Mathematics.
Three (3) or more relevant elective passes at C6/D or better.
level_note: Aimed at building practical digital and IT support skills.
Can act as bridge into more advanced computing degrees.

note: Offers business and management programmes that blend theory, ethics and practical skills.
Emphasizes entrepreneurship, leadership, quantitative skills and the integration of faith and professional life.
Graduates work in banking, finance, agribusiness, consulting, NGOs and public sector management.

fees: Business Administration: see current Business Administration fee band by campus (Okwahu, Kumasi, Tema).
salary: Business graduates’ salaries vary widely across banking, corporate, SME and NGO sectors; managerial roles pay more with experience.
cutt_off: General undergraduate aggregate requirement (36/24 or better) with appropriate business or arts electives.
mode: Full-time on-campus; some campuses also run weekend streams for working students.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science/Social Studies plus three (3) relevant Electives (e.g. Accounting, Business Management, Economics, Elective Mathematics, General Arts subjects).
Other recognised qualifications (GCE, ABCE, Diplomas) are assessed per University policy.
level_note: Provides broad training in key business functions with specialisations such as Marketing, Accounting, Finance, Banking and Human Resource Management.
Suitable foundation for professional qualifications and postgraduate management studies.

career: Value Chain and Supply Chain Officer

fees: Agribusiness: fee band similar to other Business/Development programmes; see current schedule for details.
electives: Agricultural Value Chains and Supply Chains
salary: Agribusiness incomes range from salaried project/operations roles to entrepreneurial earnings in production, processing and marketing.
cutt_off: Applicants should have science/agricultural or business background with acceptable aggregates meeting the general 36/24 or better rule.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE: Three (3) core subjects including English Language and Mathematics, and three (3) elective subjects from Science/Agriculture/Business or related fields.
Diploma/HND holders in agriculture or related disciplines may gain advanced standing after interview and evaluation.
level_note: Integrates agriculture with business principles to create value along agricultural value chains.
Well-suited for students aiming to modernise agriculture or build agribusiness ventures.

fees: Total programme fees are listed under graduate business programmes; students should confirm current MSC Financial Risk Management fees.
salary: Risk management professionals, especially in financial institutions, can earn above-average salaries, scaling with responsibility and expertise.
mode: Evening/weekend to accommodate working finance professionals.
entry_requirements: Good first degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Business Administration or related field.
Quantitative aptitude and preferably some professional or industry experience.
Compliance with Graduate Studies application procedures.
level_note: Equips graduates with quantitative and regulatory knowledge required for managing financial risks.
Ideal for professionals in banking, insurance, investment management and corporate finance.

courses.course_name: MBA Human Resource Management and Development

fees: MBA HRM & Development: fee band comparable to other professional MBAs at the University; details are published per cohort.
salary: MBA graduates in HR often move into mid- to senior-level HR roles with associated salary scales.
mode: Evening/weekend or modular format suited to working professionals.
entry_requirements: First degree in any recognised field (preferably with HR, management or social sciences background) plus relevant work experience.
Meeting School of Graduate Studies requirements (references, CV, possible interview).
level_note: Focuses on strategic HR, leadership and capacity development within organisations.
Suited to HR practitioners and managers aspiring to senior responsibilities.

courses.course_name: Extended Diploma in Business and Management

fees: Diploma business programmes use the standard business diploma fee band.
salary: Diploma holders typically occupy junior supervisory or administrative roles; salaries depend on organisation and sector.
mode: Full-time; some flexible or weekend deliveries possible.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with passes in six (6) subjects including English Language and Mathematics and at least three (3) credit passes in relevant business/arts electives.
Other equivalents accepted according to National Accreditation Board-approved standards.
level_note: Offers intermediate business and management skills for SHS graduates and workers.
Provides a route into degree-level Business Administration with good performance.

fees: Standard business diploma fee band; check current schedule.
salary: Prepares for entry-level positions; pay improves with experience and further qualifications.
mode: Full-time; possibly modular or weekend in some centres.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with six (6) passes including English Language and Mathematics and some elective credits.
Mature candidates with work experience may be considered subject to regulations.
level_note: Foundational programme for business careers and further studies.
Designed for SHS leavers who want business skills but may not yet meet direct degree entry requirements.

note: Focuses on development, environment, natural resources and related policy and practice.
Programmes combine social sciences, environmental science and management to address development challenges.
Graduates work in NGOs, government agencies, international organisations and community development initiatives.

fees: International Development uses the development studies fee band; verify from the official schedule.
salary: Development roles vary from modest NGO pay to more competitive international agency packages.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with general minimum aggregates and relevant electives from Arts, Social Sciences, Business or related areas.
Other equivalent qualifications (GCE, diplomas, mature applicants) accepted as per University guidelines.
level_note: Interdisciplinary programme for students passionate about social and economic development locally and globally.
Good base for roles in NGOs, policy think tanks, international development and postgraduate studies.

courses.course_name: BSc. Environmental and Natural Resources Management
career: Resource Use and Policy Analyst (entry level)

fees: Environmental and Natural Resources Management fees fall under the science/development band; check schedule.
salary: Environmental and resources roles have varied pay; international projects and consulting typically pay more.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
Includes fieldwork and practical projects.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with science or agriculture background, meeting general aggregates for undergraduate programmes.
Diploma/HND holders in environment-related disciplines may gain advanced placement after review.
level_note: Prepares graduates for careers managing environmental and natural resources sustainably.
Bridges environmental science and development policy.

career: Senior Researcher in Environment and Development
Senior Programme Manager in NGOs/International Organisations
Consultant in Environmental and Development Projects
Think Tank or Research Institute Fellow
Author and Thought Leader in Sustainable Development

fees: PhD programmes have a total fee spread over years; applicants should consult the School of Graduate Studies for current amounts and payment plans.
salary: Doctoral graduates can access senior academic, policy and consulting roles with corresponding compensation.
mode: Research-focused with seminars, comprehensive exams (where applicable) and thesis.
Part-time options may be available for professionals.
entry_requirements: Relevant Masters degree (e.g. in Environment, Development Studies, Geography, Planning, Natural Resources Management) from a recognised institution.
Evidence of research capacity and a viable research proposal.
Satisfaction of doctoral admission procedures (e.g. interviews, proposal defence).
level_note: Trains researchers and leaders to tackle complex environment–development challenges.
Appropriate for those targeting high-level academic or policy roles.

career: Programme Manager/Officer in NGOs and International Agencies

fees: MA International Development Studies fees are set by the School of Graduate Studies; total programme cost is published per intake.
salary: IDS graduates work in development agencies and NGOs; pay scales depend on organisation (local vs international) and seniority.
mode: Often structured for working professionals (evening/weekend/modular).
entry_requirements: Good first degree in Development Studies, Social Sciences, Humanities, Business or related areas.
Relevant professional experience in development work is a significant advantage.
Meets School of Graduate Studies’ additional criteria.
level_note: Interdisciplinary programme drawing on economics, politics, sociology, history and policy studies.
Equips students with analytical and practical skills for development work at multiple levels.

fees: Listed under the science/health graduate fee band; check School of Graduate Studies fees.
salary: Environmental health professionals’ incomes vary by government, NGO and private sector roles; some international posts offer higher pay.
mode: Block/part-time-friendly design for working practitioners.
entry_requirements: First degree in Environmental Health, Public Health, Environmental Science, Natural Resources or related fields.
Relevant work experience in environmental health or public health is an advantage.
level_note: Focuses on the intersection of environment, sanitation and human health.
Targets professionals in local government, health services, NGOs and international agencies.

career: Consultant in Natural Resources and Conservation

fees: Under the Environment and Development graduate fee band; consult School of Graduate Studies.
salary: Resource management professionals may work in government, NGOs, private sector and international agencies with varied salary structures.
mode: Part-time-compatible formats for practitioners.
entry_requirements: Good first degree in Natural Resources Management, Environmental Science, Agriculture, Forestry, Geography or related disciplines.
Field experience in natural resources or environment is an advantage.
level_note: Addresses sustainable management of forests, water, biodiversity and other natural resources.
Appropriate for mid-career professionals seeking specialised resource management expertise.

note: Provides a solid legal education grounded in ethics and social responsibility.
Prepares students for professional legal training and diverse law-related careers.
Emphasizes analytical thinking, advocacy and knowledge of Ghanaian and international law.

career: Lawyer (after professional law school and bar admission)
Legal Officer in Corporations and Public Institutions
Consultant in Legal and Regulatory Matters
Corporate Governance and Company Secretarial Support

fees: Law programmes often carry higher tuition than some other disciplines; current LL.B fee levels are published by the University.
salary: Legal professionals’ incomes range widely from modest early-career earnings to high senior-level remuneration depending on practice area and setting.
mode: Full-time on-campus.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE/GBCE with strong aggregates and appropriate electives; Law is typically more competitive than some other programmes.
Degree-holders may enter via graduate-entry LL.B streams if offered.
Further details follow National Accreditation Board and Ghana Legal Council guidelines and University-specific criteria.
level_note: Academic law degree preparing students for entry into professional legal training at the Ghana School of Law or equivalent.
Also relevant for non-practising careers in policy, governance and corporate regulation.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) & Conflict Management
career: HR or Employee Relations Practitioner with ADR skills
Corporate Negotiation and Dispute Management Support

fees: Certificate courses in ADR & Conflict Management have separate short-course fees; check current professional programmes list.
levels.duration: Short professional programme (weeks to a few months)
electives: Introduction to ADR Concepts and Processes
ADR in Workplace and Community Settings
salary: Enhances the value of existing roles; remuneration impact depends on primary profession and role responsibilities.
mode: Evening/weekend for working professionals.
Highly interactive and practice-oriented.
entry_requirements: Open to graduates and working professionals from law, business, HR, community development and related fields.
Basic tertiary education or substantial relevant experience recommended.
level_note: Designed to equip participants with practical tools for managing disputes without litigation.
Useful complement to law, HR, management and community leadership roles.

note: Trains health professionals to serve communities with competence, compassion and integrity.
Programmes focus on preventive and curative health, with strong community orientation.
Graduates work in hospitals, clinics, public health institutions, NGOs and faith-based health services.

career: Clinical Officer in Hospitals and Clinics

fees: Physician Assistantship: one of the higher-fee undergraduate programmes; specific per-semester fees are published by campus.
salary: Physician Assistants in Ghana receive clinical professional salaries set largely by public service or private employer scales.
cutt_off: Highly competitive; requires strong science background with good aggregates (typically WASSCE aggregate 36 or better with high grades in science electives).
mode: Full-time on-campus with extensive clinical rotations.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with three (3) Elective Science subjects (e.g. Biology, Chemistry, Physics) plus three (3) Core subjects including English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science; aggregate 36/24 or better.
GCE O-Level plus A-Level science subjects route accepted.
Other relevant health-related diplomas (e.g. Advanced Diploma in Community Medicine) may allow advanced standing after interview.
level_note: Prepares mid-level medical personnel to provide diagnostic and therapeutic services under appropriate supervision.
Strong emphasis on both clinical skills and community-based practice.

career: Environmental Health and Sanitation Officer (with appropriate placement)
Programme Officer in Health NGOs and International Agencies

fees: Public Health fees are in the health sciences band; moderate-high relative to non-clinical disciplines.
salary: Public Health graduates’ salaries depend on whether they work in government, NGOs, international agencies or private sector.
mode: Full-time on-campus with field and practicum components.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with science or relevant backgrounds meeting general aggregates and required Core subject passes.
Candidates with health-related diplomas may obtain advanced standing after evaluation.
level_note: Emphasises prevention, health promotion and population health approaches.
Suitable for those interested in improving community and national health outcomes.

career: Lecturer/Trainer in Public Health (with further experience)

fees: MPH total fees are moderate relative to similar private institutions; details are on the graduate fees schedule.
salary: MPH graduates often move into mid- to senior-level public health roles; salaries vary widely by employer and level.
mode: Designed for working professionals (may be one-year intensive or modular formats).
entry_requirements: First degree in Public Health, Medicine, Nursing, Environmental Health, Pharmacy or related health fields.
Relevant work experience in health sector strongly preferred.
Satisfaction of School of Graduate Studies’ requirements.
level_note: Advanced professional public health degree focusing on leadership, analysis and practical impact.
Appropriate for health professionals moving into population health and management roles.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Health Services Management and Administration
career: Health Records and Administration Officer (enhanced role)
Administrative Coordinator in Clinics and Hospitals

fees: Short-course fees for Health Services Management are set per cohort; see professional/short-course fee list.
electives: Leadership and Teamwork in Health Facilities
salary: Adds management capabilities to clinical or administrative roles; salary impact depends on primary position.
mode: Weekend/evening delivery for working health professionals.
entry_requirements: Health professionals or administrators with at least a diploma or degree and/or relevant experience.
level_note: Helps clinicians and administrators manage health facilities more effectively.
Good stepping stone towards further health management studies.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Occupational Health, Safety and Environmental Management
career: HSE Officer in Industry or Health Facilities

fees: Professional certificate fees vary and are communicated each intake.
electives: Principles of Occupational Health and Safety
salary: Enhances ability to take on HSE-related responsibilities; salary depends on sector and core job role.
mode: Weekend/evening for professionals in healthcare, industry and related sectors.
entry_requirements: Workers in health, industry, local government or related sectors seeking HSE knowledge.
Basic tertiary education or demonstrated experience.
level_note: Provides foundational skills in occupational health, safety and environmental management.
Relevant for clinical and non-clinical professionals.

note: Trains teachers, educational leaders and researchers for schools, colleges and education-related institutions.
Emphasizes pedagogy, curriculum development, educational leadership and research skills.
Aligns with national education standards and needs.

career: Social Studies Teacher (Basic and Secondary Levels)

fees: Education degrees often have moderate tuition levels; check the B.Ed fee band.
salary: Teachers’ salaries are mainly determined by national education service scales and school type.
mode: Full-time on-campus, with teaching practice placements.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with general aggregates and electives suitable for Social Studies (e.g. History, Government, Geography, Economics, CRS).
Diploma-in-Education holders may gain advanced standing where applicable.
level_note: Prepares graduates to teach Social Studies and serve as reflective practitioners and leaders in education.
Includes significant school-based teaching practice.

fees: M.Ed programme fee is set by School of Graduate Studies; moderate compared to market and payable by modular instalments.
salary: M.Ed graduates often progress into leadership and specialised roles within educational institutions and agencies.
mode: Flexible schedules (weekend/modular) to support in-service teachers.
entry_requirements: First degree in Education or related field from a recognised institution.
Teaching or education-related experience typically required.
Additional requirements such as references and interviews.
level_note: Focuses on professional management and transformative leadership in education.
Provides skills for educational research and evidence-based practice.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Advanced Research and Academic Publication
career: Graduate Student with strengthened research skills

fees: Short professional fees are communicated per intake.
electives: Peer Review and Ethics in Research
salary: Primarily improves academic career prospects and capacity to secure research funding.
mode: Block or weekend sessions oriented toward academics and postgraduate students.
entry_requirements: Postgraduate students, academics or professionals engaged in research.
Basic research background recommended.
level_note: Strengthens participants’ ability to design studies, analyse data and publish in reputable outlets.
Helps build an academic and research career profile.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Public Service Leadership and Governance
career: Programme Coordinator in Public Sector Projects

fees: Governance-related certificate fees are set per intake and announced by the University.
salary: Enhances leadership capacity in existing public service roles; salary impact is indirect through promotion prospects.
mode: Weekend/evening format for public servants.
entry_requirements: Public servants and NGO workers in governance-related roles.
Basic tertiary education or substantial experience.
level_note: Equips participants with tools for ethical and effective leadership in governance and public administration.
Relevant for aspiring and current managers in the public sector.

fees: Short-course fees in Project Management are outlined in the professional programmes list.
electives: Budgeting and Financial Management in Projects
salary: Improves suitability for project roles across sectors; pay depends on main position and sector.
mode: Weekend/evening sessions tailored to working professionals.
entry_requirements: Tertiary students, graduates and professionals engaged in project work.
Basic numeracy and communication skills.
level_note: Provides practical foundations aligned with project management standards.
Applicable across education, health, development, corporate and public sector projects.

courses.course_name: Certificate in Child and Adolescent Psychotherapy
career: Child and Adolescent Counselling Assistant (with professional supervision)

fees: Psychotherapy certificate fees are announced for each cohort.
electives: Therapeutic Approaches with Children and Adolescents
salary: Adds value to existing roles in education, social work and NGOs; direct salary impact depends on primary role.
mode: Weekend/block teaching suitable for teachers, counsellors and social workers.
entry_requirements: Professionals in education, psychology, social work, ministry and related fields.
Basic tertiary education or equivalent experience.
level_note: Enhances capacity to support children and young people with emotional and psychological challenges.
Not a licence to practise independently as a clinical psychologist, but an important professional enhancement.

fees: Emotional Intelligence certificate fees are published in the professional programmes fee schedule.
salary: Helps improve performance and leadership potential, which can support long-term career and salary growth.
mode: Weekend or evening delivery.
entry_requirements: Open to professionals and students seeking personal and leadership development.
No strict academic prerequisites beyond basic tertiary-level literacy.
level_note: Supports personal and professional growth by strengthening emotional and interpersonal competencies.
Useful for educators, managers, counsellors and leaders across sectors.

note: Trains nurses and midwives to provide holistic, patient-centred care.
Programmes are aligned with national regulatory standards for nursing and midwifery education.
Graduates work in hospitals, clinics, community health settings and international health organisations.

fees: Nursing: one of the higher-fee undergraduate programmes; detailed amounts are in the health sciences fee band.
salary: Nursing salaries in Ghana are determined mainly by public service scales and private facility policies; international opportunities can yield higher earnings.
mode: Full-time on-campus with clinical rotations in accredited health facilities.
entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE with appropriate science/home economics/general arts backgrounds and specified aggregate thresholds (typically 36/24 or better with key subjects at C6 or better).
SRN/RGN and other nursing diploma holders may enter at advanced levels on successful interview.
level_note: Prepares graduates for professional registration as nurses subject to regulatory requirements.
Strong community and practical orientation consistent with the University’s mission.

career: Family Planning and Reproductive Health Officer

fees: Midwifery fees are in the same health sciences band as Nursing and Physician Assistantship.
salary: Midwives’ salaries are set largely by national and institutional pay scales for health professionals.
mode: Full-time on-campus with extensive clinical practice.
entry_requirements: Science/home economics/general arts backgrounds meeting specified aggregates and subject requirements per University and Nursing and Midwifery Council guidelines.
SRN/RGN and other relevant certificate holders may gain advanced standing after assessment.
level_note: Focuses on comprehensive care of women and newborns across the maternity continuum.
Addresses maternal and neonatal health priorities in Ghana and beyond.
